body_content.explanation: the action of bringing something together again in a large number or amount in one particular area:
examples: A declaration of emergency entails a reconcentration of power in the hands of the executive.
This reduction in funding to the project will lead to a re-concentration of the poor in certain areas.

body_content.explanation: the action of making a liquid or substance stronger and reducing its size again, by removing water from it:
examples: Some of the processes lead to progressive dilution, others to physical or biological reconcentration.
He was involved in laboratory studies on the reconcentration of fission products and plutonium in sediments, seaweed and fish.
